lead_paragraph: Under a new Boston University campus policy, anyone caught swearing or taunting opposing players with racist or sexist chants during games faces ejection, and repeated offenders could be barred. Kenneth Elmore, the dean of students, said the rule followed a stream of complaints about students’ behavior at hockey games. Even N.C.A.A. hockey officials have complained, he said. Elmore said stadium ushers would enforce the policy. The policy is based on similar rules at other colleges, including Wisconsin and Ohio State, the university said.
